awd_titl_txt: Advancing STEM Industries through Student Scholarships and Support Services
awd_abstract_narration:
In order to address the needs of regional employers, this project at Chippewa Valley Technical College (CVTC) is creating pathways for its students to pursue careers in the STEM professional workforce.  One pathway is providing well-qualified associate's degree graduates to employers in fields such as advanced manufacturing, construction and computing, while a second pathway leads to transfer to four-year institutions to pursue higher academic degrees as STEM majors.  In addition to serving the needs of a growing industrial presence in western Wisconsin, the project is establishing a point of entry into STEM higher education for students in several rural high school districts in the vicinity of CVTC.

From a technical standpoint, the project is awarding 100 S-STEM scholarships to full-time students enrolled in the following associate's degree programs at CVTC: Industrial Engineering Technician, Civil Engineering Technician, Manufacturing Engineering Technologist, Information Technology-Network Specialist, Information Technology-Software Developer and Nano Engineering Technology.  Besides the scholarships, support for the S-STEM scholars includes monthly events that focus on future educational and professional opportunities, access to a STEM Career Advisor, peer-led study groups and mentoring by faculty, alumni and industry professionals.  Through the use of institutional research data and student surveys, outcomes being measured include the impact of the project on the enrollment, academic performance, retention and graduation of the S-STEM scholars, employment secured by program graduates and successful transfers to four-year institutions.

por.por_cntn:
A total of 213 scholarships totaling $507,631 was distributed over the five-year grant period.A majority of the students were in the IT field.

Scholarship recipients are counted by semester. For each of the five academic years, the total number of students receiving scholarships was 18, 28, 29, 30, and 25. From the start of the scholarship program, 89 different students received at least one semester of support.  One student graduated in a STEM field and then changed majors to another STEM qualifying field.That student was then added as ?new?.  Therefore, the 5-year total of ?New Recipients? is listed at 90 but 89 different students received scholarships. See the table below for the semester award totals.

Academic Year 2014-15 2015-16 2016-17
Fall Spring Academic Year Total Fall Spring Academic Year Total Fall Spring Academic Year Total
New Recipients 18 1 19 11 10 21 16 3 19
Continuing Recipients 0 17 17 8 12 20 10 23 33
Total Scholarships 18 18 36 19 22 41 26 26 52
Scholarship Dollars $41,435.50 $41,435.50 $82,871 $46,423 $48,079 $94,502 $62,268 $61,268 $123,536
Academic Year 2017-18 2018-19 5 Year Totals
  Fall Spring Academic Year Total Fall Spring Academic Year Total
New Recipients 10 7 17 12 2 14 90
Continuing Recipients 13 16 29 11 13 24 123
Total Scholarships 23 23 46 23 15 38 213
Scholarship Dollars $56,461 $57,500 $113,961 $56,266 $36,495 $92,761 $507,631

Of the 89 unique students over the five-year grant cycle, 50 went on to graduate in his/her STEM field
